embeds.title: Devastate
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 5 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 6 (9) damage 3 times.
Costs 1 less **:e_champ:** for each Finisher played this combat.

messages.content: were getting to boss daily polls
uhh
i messed up the bot
how?
"Daily Discussion 89/99"
basically "downfall" changed to "Downfall" and i didnt realise
anyway cool snecko eye only card
I've not once taken this card

powerful card. It takes a bit to get online, but with just 3 finishers you get a really strong attack that benefits from vigor 3 times. One of the many attacks you can center your whole deck around on champ
the main problem this card has is that as a rare card, you don't often have the chance to build into it
Honestly I have never had a run where I center my whole deck around 1 attack as champ
5 energy 27 dmg "27 dmg at blasphemous prices" "may god smite us for our hubris"

I think that compared to other multihits champ had, this is such a huge condition. You most likely won't get to play it in your first deck cycle, and by the time you get through your 2nd cycle most things are dead.
would devastate be good if it was 3 damage 6(9) times?
Champ just kills things so fast, so a slow card just doesn't help too much
Yes it would be OP as hell
how so?
Champ has access to strength and vigor.

its not really a huge condition, champ wants to spam stances and with cards like moment of truth you can feasibly play 3 finishers in a turn to get this down to 2 cost; which makes it playable. If the fight goes on (so bosses) devastate will go down to zero cost and becomes champs best attack
With 6 vigor, which you can get from just simply using all 3 skill bonuses in berserker. That would be 81 damage when upgraded.
How often do you play 3 finishers in 1 turn? I usually average 0-2, I'd say a little over 1 per turn.
With moment of truth basically every turn is at at least 2 finishers because that card is broken
So it takes until like turn 3 or 4 to get this to 1-2 cost. Most finishers are attacks and use up vigor.
So you may still need to build up vigor.
And by the time you do this, you could've probably killed the enemy 3 times over.
This is imo only good for boss fights, even elites champ just breezes through.
champ try to not 1 turn kill elite challenge (impossible)
https://tenor.com/view/spongebob-gif-21134362
yes, but the card is still enough for hallway fights and having an out to DEVASTATE bosses is valueble
the real use of devastate is if you have 2 energy relics
whats the energy per dmg conversion on a full price devastate+ btw?
In my last 3 champ runs I think I ended most hallway fights on turn 2.
Champ doesn't need a slow buildup card for hallway fights
Champ kills hallway fights very fast.
would be even funnier if you made it may neow smite us
The only hallway fights I could see it being useful in are snecko and transient.
Champ doesn't struggle much on elites either tbh
this card is less of a card issue and more of a champ issue
imagine downfall styled bosses but as the boss characters, so like with relics, plays cards ect.
Yeah Champ overall is just so overtuned that a lot of average cards are bad by comparison
champ skipping a 19X27 dmg 0 cost card (its bad compared to his other cards)
I think that downfall characters are more complicated, some of them it would be hard to convey their ui without being overly complicated.
But it would be cool
How would Gremlins and Snecko work?
snecko is just a pure rng fight
you could get a free turn
or be hit by 3 0 cost bludgeon
and gremlins are just non existent
snecko would be just 3 random cards from the entire game each turn :Clueless:
Dude imagine getting 30 weak for existing against fat gremlin
Then all of a sudden they have 100 temp hp
imagine like an acual bossfight thats just a bunch of medium hp enemies
Alright I gotta go get ready for work, I've laid in bed for 2 hours now
Ive had that idea

Devastate run. The swap into dome encouraged bunkering up and playing defensively, which made devastate a good attack choice here when I got it from the first boss (picked up the 2rd in act 3, alongside bracers which broke the run)

<shield throw> would of done better here admittedly, but it never showed up. In general most cards of devastates style (like enraged blow and steel edge) have to compete with shield throw, when played in this way

embeds.title: Shield Throw
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 1 (0) :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal damage equal to your **Block:p_block:**, twice.
Gain 2 **Frail:p_frail:**.
Defensive **Combo:** Don't gain **Frail:p_frail:**.

messages.content: In general champ can sort of just do whatever he wants and have it work though. So I understand why a 5 cost attack can be unappealing
Yeah shield throw existing really just makes other attacks look bad
Because champ can really stack block high, and getting to deal 20 damage for 0 cost in act 1 is pretty nutty
Honestly if shield throw was 3(2) it would still be viable

I don't think this card is bad per say, but It just feels like there are much easier ways to get the same benefits. It's a rare, so you either need to pay a lot for it, or draft it over two other rares after beating the act boss, so there is significant opportunity cost, and it only hits 1 more time than the starter card. It's actively bad if you draw it on turn 1 or 2, close to being a straight curse, though it can become a very good card by turn 4, and is obviously really nice in boss fights, however, champ is really good at short hallway and elite fights, so adding a potential brick to your strong early turns is pretty unappealing. Can do some really nice things if you have snecko eye or runic pyramid to wait for it's cost to go down, and goes really well with strength gain and vigor, but I would really rather take more consistent multihit cards.
